extendedIngredients.name: ranch dressing mix
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (1 oz) package dry Ranch-style dressing mix

title: Simple Ranchy Breaded Fish Fillets
summary: Simple Ranchy Breaded Fish Fillets might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This pescatarian recipe has 308 calories, 26g of protein, and 14g of fat per serving. For $2.58 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 88 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 25 minutes. If you have vegetable oil, tilapia fillets, dressing mix, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the butter you could follow this main course with the Cinnamon Butter Cake as a dessert. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 60%. Simple Ranchy Breaded Fish Fillets, Easy Breaded Fish Fillets, and Breaded Pollock Fillets for 2 are very similar to this recipe.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Place the bread crumbs in a bowl. In a shallow dish, mix the dressing mix and oil to form a paste. Coat the tilapia fillets with the paste, then dredge in the bread crumbs to lightly coat.                        Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Place the fillets in the skillet, and cook 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and easily flaked with a fork.

steps.step: Place the bread crumbs in a bowl. In a shallow dish, mix the dressing mix and oil to form a paste. Coat the tilapia fillets with the paste, then dredge in the bread crumbs to lightly coat.
Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Place the fillets in the skillet, and cook 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and easily flaked with a fork.
